desc: With recent advances in neuroscience, we can now describe the biological correlates of many psychological disorders, including schizophrenia, depression and anxiety disorders. In this discussion-based course, students use published research findings to examine the connections between the symptoms of these pathologies and changes in brain neurobiology, biochemistry, and physiology. Prerequisites: Psychology 230, 247, and 238, or Neuroscience 234 or 239. Offered alternate years.
name: Neurobio/Psychopathol
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Psychology 230, 247, and 238, or Neuroscience 234 or 239. Offered alternate years.
title: Neurobiology of Psychopathology
